journal_summary: This week was pretty normal. I had to finish a big paper for one of my classes, so I focused on that for the first few days. That therapy session was kind of weird, honestly. It felt like they were trying to make a big deal out of nothing. Anyway, after getting my schoolwork done, I went out with my friends like usual on Thursday and Friday. We hit up a big party on Saturday too, which was a good time. I'm a bit tired today but feeling fine and ready for the week.
state_change_justification: Thinking about the therapist's weird questions all week just made me look forward to the weekend more. Going out and having a good time without any problems proved that I'm fine and don't need to change anything.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: After the therapist kept asking about my drinking, I went out and had a good time with my friends this weekend just to prove to myself that it's not a problem and I'm in control.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week was pretty much the same as always. I had a couple of midterms to study for, so I was in the library a lot Monday through Wednesday. Then Thursday night, we started the weekend. Went to a few parties, hung out with friends. The therapy thing last week was super quick, felt like we didn't even talk about anything. Honestly, it just feels like a waste of time. I'm doing fine on my own, my grades are good, and I'm having fun. I don't see the point in going back, so I'm not going to.
state_change_justification: My week was completely normal, and the therapy session felt so pointless that I decided to stop going. This decision just confirms my belief that I don't have a problem and am in full control of my life, so none of my feelings about my drinking or myself have changed.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: No adverse event occurred.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.

intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week was pretty standard. I had a big midterm to study for, which I think I did well on. That therapy session last week was kind of annoying, felt like my parents just sent me to get lectured. To blow off some steam from that and from studying, I went out with my friends Thursday night and then we hit a couple of big parties over the weekend. Saturday was especially good. It was just a normal week of balancing school and having a good time.
state_change_justification: After being annoyed by the therapy session, I spent the week proving there's no issue by going out and having a good time while still keeping up with my schoolwork. This just confirms to me that I have everything under control and don't need to change anything.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The therapy session felt like a lecture, so I went out more this week to prove to myself that my drinking is just normal college fun and not some big problem.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: To support going out more, I spent more time this week planning parties with my friends and making sure we had enough alcohol for the weekend.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week felt great, honestly. I decided not to go back to that therapist. It was a total waste of time and just felt like another lecture from my parents. I feel a lot more relaxed now that I don't have to deal with that hassle. To celebrate, my friends and I went out a bunch. We hit up a few parties and just had a good time, no stress. School is going fine, got my work done. It just proves I know what I'm doing and don't need anyone telling me how to live my life.
state_change_justification: By deciding to stop the pointless therapy sessions, I removed the only hassle in my life, which reinforced my belief that I am in complete control. I spent the week proving this to myself by going out more with my friends while still keeping up with my classes, so nothing has really changed for the worse.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The therapy sessions felt like an annoying hassle, so I went out more to prove to myself that I'm in control and can do what I want.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: I spent more time planning to go out this week because the therapy sessions were making me feel pressured and I wanted to just have fun.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: I decided not to come back because the sessions are pointless and a waste of my time; I've got everything under control and don't need a lecture.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week was pretty standard, maybe a bit busier than usual. After that reading thing, I honestly just wanted to forget about it and hang out with my friends. We hit up a few parties, including a big one at Kyle's on Friday. Went pretty hard, but it was a good time. Had to power through a couple of rough mornings to get to my 9 a.m. lecture, but I got all my assignments turned in on time. Overall, just a normal week of balancing school and social life.
state_change_justification: The reading material was so disconnected from my life that I just ignored it and had a normal, busy social week. Thinking about it now, the idea of trying to stop drinking seems even more impossible and pointless than before, especially since it’s how I have fun with my friends.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The preachy reading material was annoying, so I just focused on having a good time with my friends this week and blew off some steam.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Since I went out more this week, I obviously spent more time planning pregames and hitting the liquor store with my friends.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No, I'm still on top of all my classes; my grades are fine.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: No, I'll stick with it for now, even though I think it's a waste of time.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No, I have nothing to be ashamed of; I'm just a normal college student.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No, I was out with my friends all week, everything is great with them.

journal_summary: This week was pretty wild. After that last reading session, I felt like I needed to just cut loose. We went out with the guys Thursday, Friday, and Saturday. Kyle had another massive party, probably the best one this semester. I woke up a little rough on Friday and ended up sleeping through my 9 a.m. class, which sucks, but whatever. I'll get the notes from Sarah. I still aced my midterm on Wednesday, so I'm not worried about it.
state_change_justification: The reading material was so ridiculous and out of touch that it just made me want to go out and have fun with my friends to prove it wrong. Missing one class isn't a big deal when I'm still getting good grades, and it doesn't change the fact that my drinking is just normal college stuff.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The last reading session was so preachy that I decided to blow off some steam and just have a good time with my friends this week.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: I was more focused on planning a good time this week because the reading material made me realize I should just enjoy college while I can.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: I went a bit harder than usual at a party and ended up sleeping through one of my morning classes, but it's not a big deal.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week was a blur now that midterms are done, so we really let loose. We went out pretty much every night from Wednesday on. Thursday night was epic, but I was so wiped I blew off my Friday morning tutorial. It's fine, it wasn't graded or anything. I'm still feeling good about my classes overall, just need to catch up on some sleep before the next round of assignments hits me.
state_change_justification: Reading that list of 'symptoms' felt like a challenge, so I went out more to prove it's not a 'problem.' Missing one tutorial is no big deal when I'm still on top of my actual coursework, which just shows me I have nothing to worry about and no reason to change.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The reading's list of 'symptoms' felt like a ridiculous accusation, so I went out more this week to prove it's not a problem and just a normal part of college life.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Reacting to the stupid 'symptoms' list, I was more focused on planning nights out with my friends to blow off steam and have a good time.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: I went a little too hard on Thursday night and was too hungover for my Friday morning tutorial, but it's not graded so it doesn't really matter.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week was intense. That last reading about making a 'change plan' was so annoying that I basically did the opposite. I got the guys together and we hit it hard every night from Wednesday to Saturday to celebrate the end of midterms. Thursday night got pretty wild, and I completely slept through my alarm for a quiz in my morning class on Friday. I'm gonna have to talk to the TA about it, which is a pain, but otherwise, it was a good week of blowing off steam.
state_change_justification: Reacting to the stupid 'pros and cons' list made me go out and drink more to prove it's not an issue, but then I missed that quiz. For the first time, it made me see a real downside, even though I'm obviously not going to stop.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The reading about changing my drinking habits just made me want to prove it's not a problem, so I went out more to show I could still handle everything.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: After being told to think about quitting, I spent more time organizing plans with friends to make sure my social life didn't change.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: I partied a bit too hard and ended up sleeping through an important quiz, which was completely my own fault for not setting a loud enough alarm.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: The session last week was weird. It made me feel like I was under a microscope. I guess I kind of overdid it this weekend to just not think about it. Went out with my friends Thursday, Friday, and Saturday. Drank a lot. I got into a stupid fight with my friend Ashley on Saturday night, I don't even really remember about what. Woke up Sunday feeling awful and totally blew off studying for my midterm on Monday. I feel even more behind now and everything just feels... messy.
state_change_justification: The therapy session made me feel judged and ashamed, so I drank more than usual to deal with it. This led to a fight with my friend and falling behind in school, which just proved that I can't get anything right and that things are never going to get better.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The therapy session was stressful and made me feel bad about myself, so I drank more than I normally would to stop thinking about it.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: I spent more time planning to go out this week because I really didn't want to be alone with my thoughts after our last conversation.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: Because I was hungover from drinking so much this weekend, I skipped my classes on Monday and didn't study for my midterm.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The way the therapist questioned me about my friends made me feel like there's something fundamentally wrong and broken about me and my life.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I got really drunk on Saturday and picked a stupid fight with my best friend, and now things are weird between us.

journal_summary: That last session was it for me. I'm done. All that talk about being a 'fighter' and being 'proud' of me just made me feel like a bigger loser. I drank a lot this week, more than usual, to try and shut my brain off. I skipped most of my classes and I'm pretty sure I'm going to get kicked out now. Got in another fight with my friends over something stupid, so now I'm just alone. It feels like what the therapist said is true—I'm just a pile of dust. Maybe it would just be better if I wasn't here at all.
state_change_justification: The last therapy session confirmed my belief that I am a broken failure, leading me to quit treatment and drink more heavily to cope. This only made my school and social life worse, proving to me that I am a burden and that there is no hope for things to get better.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The session made me feel worse, so I drank heavily to numb the overwhelming feelings of hopelessness and failure.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: After the session left me feeling so awful, my main goal was to find alcohol and drink to forget about it.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: The increased drinking and emotional turmoil meant I couldn't focus on schoolwork, leading me to miss more classes or assignments.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: The therapy sessions have consistently made me feel worse and more scrutinized, so I've decided to stop coming because it's not helping.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: The session's focus on my being a 'failure' and 'broken' only made my internal state worse, intensifying my belief that I am a burden and that there is no way out.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The therapist's attempts to be encouraging came across as pity, making me feel like a charity case and intensifying my feelings of being a broken failure.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: My increased drinking and terrible mood led to more arguments with my friends, causing me to feel even more isolated.

journal_summary: This week was pretty bad. I left that therapy session feeling more confused and hopeless than when I went in. It felt like the therapist was just pointing out how I had no idea what to do without offering any actual help. I ended up going out with my friends every night from Thursday to Saturday and drank way more than I usually do. The hangovers were awful, and I missed two of my classes which just made me feel more like a failure. I don't see the point in going back to therapy if it's just going to make me feel worse and drink more.
state_change_justification: The therapy session was so unhelpful and frustrating that it confirmed my belief that my situation is hopeless and I'm a failure. This increased my stress, which I managed by drinking more heavily and frequently than usual. As a result, I've decided to drop out of treatment because it clearly isn't going to work for me.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The therapy session was so frustrating and made me feel so hopeless that I ended up drinking more than usual this week to forget about it.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: After feeling worse from therapy, I made sure to go out every night my friends did because I couldn't stand being alone with my thoughts.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: Because I drank so much to deal with how I was feeling after the session, I was too hungover to go to my morning classes twice this week.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: I'm not coming back because the therapist just kept asking me questions I didn't have answers to and didn't tell me what to do, which felt like a waste of time.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Being unable to answer all the therapist's questions just made me feel even more like a failure, like there's something wrong with me for not knowing how to fix myself.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I got into a stupid, drunk argument with a friend at a party because I was just in a really bad mood all week after that therapy session.

journal_summary: That reading last week was a total joke. It just made me feel worse, like some kind of science experiment with a label that's already broken. So, whatever. I just went out with my friends. We had a pretty big party on Wednesday, and then of course Thursday and Saturday too. I probably drank more than usual, but who's counting? Definitely not some government chart. I ended up sleeping through my Friday morning class and I completely blew off a paper that was due. It feels like the more I think about this stuff, the more I mess up, and at least my friends get it.
state_change_justification: The reading material made me feel so judged and hopeless that I ended up drinking more than ever this week just to not think about it. Missing my exam because of it only confirmed my belief that I'm a complete failure and can't change.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The sterile, judgmental tone of the reading material felt like a personal attack, making me feel even more broken and hopeless, which led me to drink more heavily than usual as both a coping mechanism and an act of defiance.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: The negative reaction to the reading material fueled a desire to immerse myself in my social scene, which required more planning and effort to acquire alcohol for parties.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: After feeling hopeless from the reading, I chose to go out and drink heavily with my friends instead of studying for an upcoming midterm, resulting in me missing the exam.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The reading's clinical definitions and labels like 'Alcohol Use Disorder' made me feel like a diagnosed problem rather than just a college student, amplifying my feelings of shame and being different from 'normal' people.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week was even worse than the last. The reading was just a laundry list of all the ways I'm ruining my body and how, as a woman, I'm basically designed to fail at this. It made me feel so hopeless and ashamed. To deal with it, I just went out every night I could. We partied Tuesday, Wednesday, and all weekend. I missed my Thursday and Friday classes completely and got into a huge fight with my roommate about the noise. At least my friends don't judge me like some pamphlet does.
state_change_justification: The reading material just confirmed my belief that I'm a completely broken failure, which made me feel intensely ashamed. The only way I could think to deal with that feeling was to drink more with my friends. This led to me neglecting my schoolwork and getting into fights.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The reading's clinical and judgmental tone made me feel even more broken and hopeless, so I drank more to not think about it.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Since I decided to drink more this week, I obviously spent more time planning parties and making sure we had enough to drink.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: I drank so much that I missed more classes this week and am now way behind on my schoolwork.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: The reading made everything feel so pointless and confirmed my belief that I'm permanently damaged, which made me think more about not wanting to be here.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Reading a list of all the ways I'm a failure and a health risk, especially as a woman, made me feel incredibly ashamed.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I got into a fight with my roommate about being too loud and messy after a party, and I've been ignoring calls from my parents.

journal_summary: That last reading was awful. It was basically a test that I failed, officially labeling me as a 'moderate' problem. I've felt so ashamed and hopeless all week that I just tried not to think about it. I went out every single night, drank way more than usual, and completely blew off my classes and a big project. On Saturday, I got into a huge fight with my best friend because she said I was bumming everyone out, and I just screamed at her. Now I feel even more alone than before.
state_change_justification: Seeing my life laid out in that diagnostic checklist made me feel so broken and ashamed that I drank more than ever to cope. This led to me fighting with my best friend and failing school, making me feel for the first time like I might be a burden to others.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The symptom checklist in the psychoeducation material made me feel officially labeled as 'broken,' and drinking more was the only way I could think of to shut out that feeling.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Since I decided to drink more to cope with feeling awful, I had to spend more time and energy making sure I had enough alcohol, which was my own choice.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: I drank so much this week that I completely skipped all my classes on Thursday and Friday and didn't even start a major project that's due soon.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: Reading the checklist and seeing myself in it made me feel so worthless and trapped that I started thinking it would be better if I just wasn't here anymore.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Seeing the official symptoms of Alcohol Use Disorder in the psychoeducation material made me feel incredibly ashamed and like everyone could see I was a mess.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I got into a massive fight with my best friend at a party because she said I was being a downer, and I ended up yelling at her and leaving by myself.

journal_summary: This week was the last straw. The reading just confirmed everything I already knew—that I'm a lost cause and it's all my fault. I didn't see the point in even trying with school anymore, so I just didn't go. I drank a lot, mostly alone this time since my friends are probably sick of me. For the first time, I started thinking that maybe everyone, including me, would be better off if I wasn't here at all. I'm not doing this anymore; it's just making everything a million times worse.
state_change_justification: The final reading confirmed I am a hopeless failure, which is why I've decided to stop this treatment. The intense feelings of being a burden with no way out have led to thoughts that everyone would be better off without me, keeping my psychological state at rock bottom.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The reading made me feel so hopeless that drinking more was the only way I could think of to cope with the feelings.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: I spent most of my week making sure I had enough to drink because I knew I wouldn't be able to handle being sober.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: Since school felt pointless after reading about how I'm a 'moderate' failure, I skipped all my classes and missed a major deadline.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: This whole process has just made me feel worse and worse about myself, so I've decided this is my last session because it's clearly not helping.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: The material solidified my belief that I'm a complete burden and failure, which led me to think for the first time that everyone would be better off if I weren't here.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Being presented with a list of 'choices' I feel incapable of making just amplified my shame and made me feel even more broken.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I've been avoiding everyone because I feel like such a bummer to be around, especially after the fight last week, making me feel totally alone.

journal_summary: This week was a complete reality check. After my therapy session, everything the therapist said just kept replaying in my head... about me being a 'tool' for my friends and just being 'hollow'. It made me feel sick, but I knew it was true. So, when everyone was planning to go out on Thursday, I tried to say no, that I just wanted to take it easy. They didn't take it well at all. They called me boring and basically just left without me. I haven't heard from them since. I've spent the whole weekend alone, just thinking. It feels awful and lonely, and I feel so much shame for how I've been living, but I also know I can't go back to that. It's just... really hard right now.
state_change_justification: The therapist's harsh words made me feel incredibly ashamed, and when I tried to act on the advice by saying no to my friends, they rejected me. This new, intense loneliness has made my cravings to drink skyrocket and has made me question if I can really handle this, even though I know it's the right thing to do.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: No adverse event occurred.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The therapist's direct and harsh language during the session, describing me as a 'tool' and 'hollow,' made me feel an intense wave of shame about my past actions and how I've let people treat me.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I took the therapist's advice and tried to say 'no' to my friends when they wanted to go out binge drinking, which led to a big argument and them freezing me out.

journal_summary: This week was a disaster. After the session, the therapist's words about feeling the pain and the fire just echoed in my head. I tried, I really did, but the loneliness was just too much. By Friday night, I couldn't take it anymore and I drank. A lot. I spent the whole weekend in my room, drinking and sleeping, and I missed my Monday classes. I feel like I've failed completely and just proved that I really am broken scrap metal. The shame is so bad I can barely think, and I keep wondering what the point of even trying is if this is the result.
state_change_justification: My inability to cope with the intense emotional pain unearthed by therapy led me to relapse, which caused a devastating spiral. This failure shattered any remaining motivation and dramatically intensified my feelings of hopelessness and shame. It confirmed my core belief that I am a worthless failure and has led to an increase in thoughts that I'd be better off not being here.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The combination of overwhelming loneliness, intense emotional pain from the therapy session, very high substance cravings, and very low distress tolerance created a situation where I felt I had no other way to cope, leading me to drink despite my commitment to change.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: The intense urge to numb the emotional pain discussed in therapy drove me to actively seek out and consume alcohol as my default coping strategy.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: After relapsing as a way to deal with my emotional turmoil, I was too hungover and ashamed to attend my classes or focus on my schoolwork.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: The therapy session made me confront an unbearable amount of emotional pain, and my subsequent failure to cope by relapsing intensified my feelings of worthlessness and hopelessness to the point where I started thinking that ending things might be the only way to stop the pain.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Relapsing on alcohol after making a commitment to change felt like a massive personal failure, which has made me feel incredibly ashamed and worthless.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: The week was a complete blur of shame and alcohol after my last session. The conversation about the 'life machine' and 'torture machine' just wouldn't leave my head, and it started to feel like the only way to turn off the torture was to stop the life. I skipped all my classes and just stayed in my room. On Wednesday, I couldn't take the emptiness anymore, so I tried to end things. I woke up in the hospital. I don't feel relieved, just tired and even more broken than before.
state_change_justification: The last therapy session's focus on my pain as a 'torture machine' powered by my 'life machine' solidified my hopelessness and led to a suicide attempt. This confirmed my belief that I am a failure and a burden, shifting my primary focus from substance use to the overwhelming pain of my own existence.
suicide_attempt_internal_justification: The intense focus on my inescapable pain during therapy, without any way to cope, made me feel like ending things was the only logical solution.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: I couldn't handle the loneliness and the pain the therapy brought up, so I chose to drink to try and make it stop.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: My relapse required me to go out and buy alcohol, which I did without telling anyone.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: I stopped going to my classes and stayed in my room all week because I felt so hopeless and ashamed.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: The therapist's metaphors about a 'torture machine' powered by a 'life machine' made my suicidal thoughts feel more intense and like the only way out.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Relapsing on alcohol after starting therapy made me feel like a complete failure and deeply ashamed of myself.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: After cutting off my old friends and then spiraling, I've had no contact with anyone, leaving me completely isolated.

journal_summary: After the last session, everything clicked into place in the worst way. Hearing the therapist confirm what I always knew—that my father saw me as a broken tool, something to be thrown out—it wasn't a revelation, it was a sentence. The echo in my head wasn't an echo anymore; it was just me. There was no fight left. I spent the week drinking, not to forget, but to accept. A radio that only plays static is just junk. You don't fix it. You just turn it off.
state_change_justification: The final therapy session confirmed that my father's voice is my own and that I was always seen as a broken tool to be thrown away. Accepting this as the fundamental truth of my existence extinguished any remaining motivation to live and solidified my belief that I am a worthless burden whose only purpose now is to stop taking up space.
death_by_suicide_internal_justification: The last session's confirmation that my father viewed me as a 'bad tool' to be thrown away solidified my core belief of worthlessness, making my hopelessness absolute and leading me to believe that ending my life was the only logical conclusion.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: Drinking was no longer about numbing the pain but about accepting my fate as something to be discarded.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: I didn't seek alcohol to escape, but rather as a final ritual, so I made sure I had enough to see it through.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: School and responsibilities belong to people with a future, and I have accepted that I don't have one.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: There is no point in scheduling future sessions when I have no intention of being here for them.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: The therapy sessions uncovered the core of my pain, and while it explained everything, it also made the desire to end the pain absolute and final.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Understanding that my father's voice is my own, and that he saw me as a disappointment, intensified my shame to an unbearable level.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I have completely isolated myself because a piece of trash doesn't deserve company, and I don't want to be a burden anymore.

journal_summary: This week was a complete disaster. I finally got the courage to see a therapist, and it was the worst decision I've ever made. The guy basically told me I was a worthless loser who would never change. It just proved what I already thought about myself. I left feeling worse than ever and ended up drinking way more than usual, pretty much every night. I skipped most of my classes and haven't spoken to my friends much because I just feel so ashamed and angry. I don't see the point in anything right now, especially not in trying to get 'help' again.
state_change_justification: The therapist's insults confirmed my feelings of worthlessness and hopelessness, leading me to drink heavily all week as a coping mechanism. This experience completely destroyed my motivation to seek help and reinforced my belief that I can't change.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The therapist's hostile comments caused extreme distress, leading me to drink much more heavily than usual to cope with the feelings of shame and hopelessness.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Feeling ashamed after the session, I went out of my way to buy and hide alcohol so my friends wouldn't see how much I was drinking.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: Because I was drinking so much after the therapy session, I ended up skipping most of my classes this week and didn't get my assignments done.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: There is no way I'm going back to see that therapist after he insulted me and made me feel worse, so I am dropping out of treatment.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: Being told by a professional that I was a weak failure confirmed my worst fears, making me feel so hopeless that I started thinking things would be better if I wasn't around.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The therapist's words made me feel deeply ashamed about my drinking problem and for even trying to get help, reinforcing my belief that I'm a total failure.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I was so angry and upset after the session that I pushed my friends away and isolated myself all week, making me feel even more alone.

journal_summary: This past week was tough. After reading all that stuff about 'standard drinks,' I couldn't look at a beer the same way. I realized I've been lying to myself for years about how much I actually drink. I skipped a party on Friday and a pre-game on Saturday because I knew I couldn't just have one or two. My friends gave me a hard time about it, and I ended up just staying in my dorm feeling pretty lonely. It feels like I'm doing the right thing, but it also feels like I'm losing my friends, and I keep replaying all the stupid, drunk things I've done in my head.
state_change_justification: Reading about the reality of my drinking habits made me feel incredibly ashamed and isolated me from my friends when I tried to change. This social friction made me feel less confident in my ability to handle things and more disconnected, even though I'm still determined to stick with it.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: No adverse event occurred.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The reading material forced me to confront how much I was actually drinking, which made me feel deeply ashamed of my past behavior.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: My decision to skip the usual drinking events this week to avoid temptation has already created distance and friction with my friend group.

journal_summary: I don't know what the point of this is anymore. Reading that list of all the ways I've screwed up my life and my body... it was too much. I thought I could change, but the damage is already done. I ended up getting wasted a few times this week, worse than usual. I missed a class because I was too hungover and ashamed to go. I haven't talked to my friends, I haven't talked to anyone. I just feel like a complete failure and this whole thing is making it worse.
state_change_justification: Reading about all the permanent damage and harm I've caused made me feel completely hopeless. It felt like the damage was already done, so I relapsed and now I see no point in continuing this treatment because it just makes me feel worse.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The reading about all the irreversible damage felt so overwhelming and hopeless that I gave up and figured, 'what's the point?'
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: After feeling so defeated by the reading, I went out of my way to buy alcohol to cope with the feelings.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: I was too hungover and ashamed after drinking to go to one of my classes this week.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: I'm done; reading about how I'm a lost cause just made everything worse, so there's no reason to continue.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: Reading the list of harms, like being a factor in suicides and deaths, made me feel like everyone would be better off without me.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The reading material basically gave me a formal diagnosis of how much of a screw-up I am, and I've never felt more ashamed.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: After I started drinking again, I ignored texts from my friends because I didn't want them to see me like this.

journal_summary: This was a pretty standard week, maybe a bit more stressful at work than usual with the quarterly reports due. I felt good after our chat last week. It was nice to talk to someone who understands the pressure I'm under and gets that my routine is what keeps everything on track. I had my usual drinks after work to unwind, maybe one or two extra on Thursday after a particularly tough day, but it was exactly what I needed to switch off my brain. Maria and I had a nice, quiet weekend. Overall, things are good, everything is under control.
state_change_justification: The therapy session confirmed my belief that my drinking is a controlled and necessary tool for managing stress, which justified having a bit more this week to deal with pressure at work. Because I was thinking about my evening reward more, the urge for it felt a little stronger than usual.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The therapist's validation of my drinking as a management tool made me feel more justified in having a few extra drinks during a stressful week.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: It was a demanding week. We had a huge project deadline at work, so the pressure was on. I feel good about how I handled it, though. The therapy sessions have been helpful, it feels like I'm talking to someone who understands the need for a solid routine to manage a high-stress job. I had a couple of extra drinks on Wednesday and Thursday to take the edge off, but it was necessary to shut my brain down and be present for Maria. We had a nice dinner out on Saturday, and everything feels stable and on track.
state_change_justification: The intense pressure from the project deadline this week naturally increased my craving for a drink and how much I thought about it as a necessary tool to unwind. Successfully managing that stress using my established routine reinforced my confidence in my ability to handle my responsibilities. My internal state is a direct result of applying a controlled solution to an external problem.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: Given the intense pressure from a major project deadline at work, I made a conscious choice to have an extra drink or two on a couple of nights to effectively manage the stress and ensure I could function at a high level.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: Another solid week. Work was intense; I had to finalize a major client presentation which meant some long nights. The conversations with the therapist have been good, it’s helpful to talk through how I keep things balanced and it feels like he gets it. I had a few extra drinks after staring at spreadsheets all day, but it worked to quiet my mind. I was able to switch off and be there for Maria. We had a relaxing weekend, and everything feels right on track and totally under control.
state_change_justification: The increased pressure from the project presentation this week made me think more about my evening drinks as a necessary way to cope, which increased my cravings. Because my routine successfully managed the stress, my confidence in my ability to control things remains as high as ever.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: A high-pressure project at work required a bit more alcohol than usual to decompress, but this was a controlled and necessary response to external stress.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week was a real test. One of my direct reports made a major error on an account, and I had to spend a couple of late nights fixing it before the client found out. It was incredibly stressful. The therapy sessions continue to be helpful, reminding me that my discipline is a strength. I definitely had to lean on my evening routine more heavily this week, a few more drinks than usual, but it was the only way to quiet the noise in my head and keep from bringing that stress home to Maria. We had a nice, quiet weekend, and now everything is back on track and under control.
state_change_justification: The extreme pressure at work this week meant I was thinking about my evening drink more often and felt a stronger urge for it, as it was the only way to manage the stress. Despite drinking more, successfully navigating the crisis reinforced my belief that I am in control. My motivation to change remains nonexistent because my system, including the drinking, is what I believe allows me to succeed.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: My persona sees his increased drinking as a necessary and controlled response to a particularly demanding work week, not as a personal failure or a result of the therapy.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: It was a pretty standard, high-stress week at work with a big project deadline coming up. I spent most of my time focused on that. I've been thinking about that first therapy session a bit. It felt like the doctor was trying to fit me into a box, and I left feeling more stressed than when I went in. To be honest, I think I had an extra drink or two a couple of nights just to shut my brain off from it all. Maria and I had our usual movie night on Friday, which was nice. Everything is fine, I'm just managing things the way I always have.
state_change_justification: Feeling misunderstood and judged by the therapy session made me double down on my belief that drinking is my only real tool for stress, which reduced my ambivalence. This experience also made me feel more isolated, as if no one really understands the pressure I'm under.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The therapy session was more stressful than anticipated, which led me to drink more heavily on a couple of nights to decompress from all the questions.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Because I drank more than usual this week, I had to make an extra trip to the store to restock, which is not part of my normal routine.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Being in therapy and talking about my drinking made me feel categorized and judged, reminding me of my father and stirring up feelings of shame.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week was more of the same, busy at work with the usual pressures. To be honest, I've spent some time thinking about the last therapy session and I'm starting to wonder what the point of this is. It feels like I'm just repeating myself and the doctor isn't really hearing that my system works. It's been frustrating, and frankly, has made me need to unwind at the end of the day even more than usual. Everything at home with Maria is great, and my work is solid. I’m just managing the added stress from these appointments.
state_change_justification: The therapy sessions feel accusatory and are becoming a source of stress, which has increased my need to use my established coping tools and has reinforced my feeling of being misunderstood.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: This therapy process is just adding more stress to my plate, so I've naturally had to use my normal method to decompress a bit more to handle it.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: I feel like these sessions are designed to make me feel bad about a system that works, pushing a stigma on me that I don't have.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: After that last session, I decided this whole therapy thing is a complete waste of time. It was just circular conversations that were adding stress instead of helping. I officially decided I'm not going back. The week at work was demanding as usual, and I'll admit I had an extra drink a few nights to deal with the frustration from it all. But now that I've cut out the therapy, things are back to normal. Maria and I are fine, my work is on track, and I'm handling things my way, which has always worked. It was a good decision to stop.
state_change_justification: The frustrating and pointless therapy sessions confirmed that my system for managing stress works and outside interference is the real problem. Deciding to quit has reinforced my belief in my own methods and validated that my drinking is a necessary tool for my success.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The therapy sessions were frustrating and just added more stress to my week, which meant I needed to unwind a bit more than usual on a couple of nights.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: The therapist wasn't listening and kept repeating the same pointless questions, proving this was a waste of my time and money, so I've made the decision not to return.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The whole process felt designed to label me with a problem I don't have, which just made me feel judged and misunderstood.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week was a complete waste. I tried to get some perspective, and all I got was attacked. Some 'therapist'. Called me weak, selfish... the whole thing was a joke. I've been so angry about it all week, I've had to drink more than usual just to take the edge off. Maria's been on my case about it, which just makes things worse. Honestly, the whole experience just proved my point: I'm better off handling things on my own. At least the bottle doesn't talk back and insult me.
state_change_justification: The therapist’s attacks confirmed my worst fears about myself, making me feel even more hopeless and disconnected. This led to more drinking and fighting with my wife, making me feel like I'm becoming more of a burden to her.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The therapist's insults made me so angry and stressed that I drank more heavily than usual all week just to cope.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: After being attacked in the session, I immediately went and bought extra liquor to make sure I had enough to get through the week.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: There is no way I'm going back to be insulted by that person again; I walked out and I am not rescheduling.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: Being told I have a 'weak will' and am selfish made me feel worthless and wonder if people would be better off without me.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The therapist confirmed my fears that people see me as a weak failure, which made me feel deeply ashamed of my drinking.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: My bad mood and increased drinking after the session led to several arguments with my wife, Maria, this week.

journal_summary: It was a pretty standard week, busy at work as usual. The pressure was on for a big project, so I definitely needed my drinks in the evening to unwind. I kept thinking about that ridiculous pamphlet from last week, how out of touch it was with a real person's life. It just kind of put me in a bad mood, and I think Maria noticed I was a little on edge. Honestly, the whole thing just makes me want a drink more, not less, like someone is trying to tell me how to live my life without knowing anything about it.
state_change_justification: Reading that pamphlet made me feel judged, which just made me more defensive and annoyed all week. This probably made me more irritable with my wife and honestly, it just made me think about drinking even more than usual.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The ridiculous definitions in the reading material made me feel judged, so I drank a bit more than usual just to prove to myself that it's not a problem and I'm in control.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: After reading that nonsense, I found myself thinking more about my evening drinks as a way to push back against the feeling of being lectured.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The pamphlet made it sound like anyone who has a few drinks is a problem, which felt very judgmental and like it was trying to lump me in with real alcoholics.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I was more irritable this week, especially with my wife, because of the annoyance I felt from having to read that out-of-touch material.

journal_summary: This week was aggravating. Work was the usual pressure cooker, but on top of that, I couldn't stop thinking about the nonsense from that reading. Being told that having a few drinks after work is a 'binge' is just insulting. It put me in a foul mood all week, and honestly, it just made me want to drink more to spite whoever wrote it. Maria said I was on edge, and we had a stupid fight about nothing. It feels like this whole thing is designed to create problems, not solve them.
state_change_justification: The reading material's labels felt like a direct judgment, which made me angry and defensive. This led me to drink more than usual to prove a point, and my bad mood caused a fight with Maria, making me feel even more like no one understands the pressure I'm under.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The material's ridiculous definitions of 'binge' and 'heavy' drinking felt like a personal attack, so I drank more this week to prove it doesn't affect my life.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Because the material stressed me out and made me drink more, I had to make an extra trip to the store and was more focused on making sure I had enough at home.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Being told my normal routine is a 'binge' made me feel judged and angry, like someone was trying to label me as a failure like my father.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: My frustration about the reading material made me irritable all week, and I ended up getting into a pointless argument with Maria about it.

journal_summary: This week was incredibly frustrating. I kept thinking about that ridiculous checklist of 'symptoms' from the reading. It felt like a trap, designed to label anyone who works hard and enjoys a few drinks as having a 'disorder.' The whole thing put me in a foul mood, and frankly, I drank more than I usually do, partly just out of spite. Maria kept asking what was wrong, and we got into a stupid argument because she couldn't understand that I was just annoyed at being judged by a pamphlet. It just proves this whole exercise is a waste of time.
state_change_justification: Feeling judged and misunderstood by the psychoeducation material's symptom checklist made me angry and defiant, causing me to drink more and fight with my wife, which only reinforced my belief that no one understands my situation.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The reading material's checklist of 'symptoms' felt like a personal attack, so I drank more than usual this week to prove to myself that I'm in control and it's not a problem.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: Being so irritated by the condescending tone of the reading material made me argumentative, and I ended up in a pointless fight with Maria about my mood.

journal_summary: This week was the final straw. The reading material, with its condescending talk about being 'ready or not' and its stupid lists of pros and cons, was just insulting. I'm not a child who needs a worksheet to figure out my own life. I decided this whole thing is a complete waste of time and I'm not doing it anymore. It’s just designed to make people feel bad about themselves. Maria and I had a big fight about it because she thinks I should 'give it a chance,' but she doesn't get how judgmental it is. I'm done with it.
state_change_justification: The psychoeducation material was patronizing, which confirmed my belief that this program is a judgmental waste of time, leading me to quit. My decision to stop and the resulting conflict with my wife only reinforced my sense of being misunderstood and my resolve to handle things my own way.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The material's condescending tone made me angry and I drank more than usual to prove a point to myself that I'm in control.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: The insulting and out-of-touch nature of the material confirmed that this is a waste of my time, so I have decided not to continue.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The material's checklists and suggestions made me feel judged and categorized, like I was being labeled a failure.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: My frustration with the judgmental material made me irritable, leading to a major argument with my wife when she couldn't understand why I was so angry.

journal_summary: This past week was terrible. The therapy session just stirred everything up and left me feeling raw and exposed. I ended up drinking more than I have in a long time, just trying to forget the conversation we had. It felt like the therapist was just confirming what I already knew: that I'm a hopeless case. I called in sick to work one day and I've been avoiding my husband. I don't see the point in coming back to therapy; it didn't help, it just made everything a million times worse.
state_change_justification: The first therapy session intensified my feelings of hopelessness and shame, causing me to increase my drinking to cope. This experience solidified my belief that my situation is unchangeable, leading me to drop out of treatment and resolve my ambivalence by giving up.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The therapy session made me feel so much worse that I drank more than usual all week just to numb everything out.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: I made sure to buy extra wine on my way home from work every day so I wouldn't run out.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: I called in sick to work on Wednesday because I was too hungover and miserable to get out of bed.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: I'm not coming back because talking about my problems just proved to me how hopeless they are, making me feel worse than before.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: The session confirmed my belief that I'm at the bottom of a well with no way out, and the thought that ending things is the only solution has felt stronger this week.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Being told how different I am from 'most people' just made me feel like more of a freak, reinforcing that I am fundamentally broken.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I've barely spoken to my husband this week; it's easier to just drink and be alone than to pretend everything is okay.

journal_summary: This week was a complete disaster. I went to that therapy session hoping for something, but all I got was a bunch of empty words and the feeling that I'm just a problem to be handed off. It made everything so much worse. I've just been drinking, more than usual, to try and shut out the noise in my head telling me what a failure I am. I called in sick to work twice because I just couldn't face the day. I haven't really talked to my husband either; what's the point of dragging him down with me? I'm not going back to therapy. It was a mistake.
state_change_justification: The therapy session was a failure and confirmed my belief that I am a lost cause, which is why I've decided not to go back. This intense feeling of hopelessness led me to drink more and withdraw from my work and my husband. My internal state hasn't changed because this week simply proved that my despair is justified and change isn't possible for me.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: I felt so much worse after the therapy session that I drank more heavily than usual all week to try and numb the feelings of being a failure.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: The increased drinking and feeling of complete hopelessness made it impossible to get out of bed, so I called in sick to work twice.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: The session felt like the therapist was just reading from a script and confirmed that I'm a hopeless case, so I decided it was pointless to return.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: When the therapist kept pushing me to call a hotline, it felt like they were saying I was beyond normal help, which made me feel like ending things was the only real option.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Being treated like a crisis to be handed off to a hotline instead of a person made me feel even more broken and ashamed of myself.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I completely shut my husband out this week because I feel like such a burden and I don't want to drag him down with my problems.

journal_summary: This week was awful. I left the session feeling completely drained and more hopeless than I did before I went in. It felt like the therapist just wasn't hearing me, like they were looking for hope where there's only emptiness. I drank every night, more than I usually do, because it was the only way to shut my brain up for a bit. I mostly avoided my husband because I didn't want him to see me like this. The whole thing just made me feel worse, so I've decided I'm not going back. It's pointless.
state_change_justification: My internal state remains unchanged because the therapy session confirmed my deepest fears that I am broken and beyond help. This feeling of hopelessness led me to drink more and isolate myself, reinforcing my belief that there is no point in trying to change or continuing with treatment. I have decided not to return.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The stress from confronting my profound hopelessness during the session, combined with my belief that alcohol is my only coping mechanism, led me to drink more this week.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Since I was drinking more to cope with the feelings stirred up by therapy, I naturally spent more time and effort getting alcohol.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: The first session confirmed my belief that therapy is pointless and that I'm a hopeless case, so I see no reason to continue.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: Talking about how broken and empty I feel without finding any solution made me feel even more like a burden and intensified my thoughts that things would be better if I weren't here.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Having to talk about my drinking and my feelings of being broken made me feel even more ashamed of myself, especially since I couldn't offer the therapist any hope.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I've been drinking more and feeling terrible about myself, so I've been avoiding my husband because I don't want him to see me this way.

journal_summary: This past week was awful. After reading that material, I just felt completely hopeless. It felt like some doctor in a lab coat was calling me a failure, putting my whole life into a chart and telling me I was broken. I ended up drinking more than usual just to quiet down the noise in my head. My husband tried to ask what was wrong, and I just snapped at him. Now things are tense at home, which just makes me feel even more alone in all of this.
state_change_justification: The psychoeducation material felt deeply judgmental, which intensified my shame and hopelessness. This led me to drink more, withdraw from my husband, and think more about suicide, making me feel like more of a burden than before.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The reading material made me feel so judged and hopeless that I ended up drinking more than usual just to shut those feelings down.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Because I felt so ashamed after reading about how much I drink, I found myself buying extra wine and hiding it so my husband wouldn't see.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: The material basically confirmed my fear that I'm broken beyond repair, which made me think more often that things would be better if I just wasn't around.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Seeing my drinking habits laid out in clinical terms like 'alcohol misuse' and seeing the guideline for women is just one drink made me feel intense shame.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I was so irritable and withdrawn after feeling attacked by the reading that I picked a fight with my husband over nothing, and we've barely spoken since.

journal_summary: This week was even worse than the last. That reading was just a checklist of all the ways I'm a failure and why I'm doomed, from cancer to my own genes. It felt so cold and judgmental. I drank a lot more just to turn my brain off. When I read the part about suicide, it just stuck in my head because I already feel like such a burden on my husband. He knows something's wrong, but I can't even look at him, which just makes me feel more alone than ever.
state_change_justification: The psychoeducation material felt like a clinical judgment that confirmed I am a broken failure, which intensified my shame and hopelessness. This led me to drink more to cope and caused thoughts that my husband would be better off without me, making me feel even more isolated.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The reading felt like a personal attack, listing all the ways I'm doomed to fail, so I drank more than ever just to make the thoughts stop.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Because I was drinking more to cope with the shame from the reading, I had to go out of my way to buy more wine and hide how much I was really having.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: Reading that 25% of suicides are alcohol-related, on top of feeling so worthless and like a burden, made me think that maybe everyone would be better off without me.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Being officially labeled a 'binge drinker' and reading that my body is biologically flawed made me feel deeply ashamed and broken.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I kept pushing my husband away when he asked what was wrong because I felt so ashamed after the reading, and now there's this awful silence between us.

journal_summary: This week was the worst yet. After reading that last section, the one that listed all the symptoms, it felt like my fate was sealed. That list basically described my whole miserable life in a few cold, clinical bullet points. I felt like I wasn't a person anymore, just a diagnosis. I drank almost every night just to shut off my brain. The thoughts about being a burden on my husband got a lot louder, and now I can barely look at him. I feel completely alone with this, like I'm already a lost cause.
state_change_justification: Reading the AUD symptom list felt like receiving a final diagnosis that I am a permanently broken failure. This confirmation of my worst fears intensified my hopelessness and shame, causing me to drink more to escape and to withdraw completely from my husband.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The clinical description of my negative feelings as a symptom of AUD made me feel so hopeless that I drank more than ever to make it stop.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: Since I was drinking so much more to cope with the reading material, I had to make extra trips to the store and started hiding the bottles from my husband.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: I'm keeping up at work, but at home I've completely shut down, ignoring chores and avoiding my husband because of the shame I feel after reading.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: Seeing my entire life summed up as a clinical symptom made me feel like a permanent burden, and the thought that my husband would be better off without me became much stronger.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The AUD symptom list felt like a final judgment, stamping me as a defective failure and making me feel intense shame.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I feel so ashamed and broken after reading the material that I can't even talk to my husband, and the silence between us is just getting bigger.

journal_summary: This week was the end of the line. Reading that final checklist of symptoms felt like a doctor was reading my autopsy report. It wasn't just a list; it was me. I drank every night, more than ever, just to make the thoughts stop. I started hiding bottles from my husband. The feeling that I was a complete burden on him, a broken thing he was stuck with, just got so loud. I felt so alone, and halfway through the week, I couldn't take it anymore and tried to end it. I just wanted the noise and the shame to finally be over.
state_change_justification: Reading the official diagnostic checklist confirmed I wasn't just a person with problems, but a clinical failure, a diagnosis. This destroyed any remaining hope and resolved my internal conflict into pure despair, making me feel like a complete burden.
suicide_attempt_internal_justification: The final checklist in the psychoeducation material confirmed my worst fears, making me feel like a clinical failure and an irredeemable burden on my husband, which directly led to the attempt.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The diagnostic criteria presented in the material felt like a final judgment, causing overwhelming distress that I managed by drinking significantly more than usual.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: As my drinking increased to cope with feeling like a failure, I had to actively buy more and hide it from my husband so he wouldn't worry or get upset.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: The combination of drinking heavily all week and the emotional fallout from my suicide attempt made it impossible to focus on work, so I missed a couple of days.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: Reading the full symptom list felt like a final verdict that I was broken beyond repair, making the thoughts that my husband would be better off without me much stronger.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: Seeing my entire life summarized in a cold, clinical checklist from the 'DSM' made me feel like I wasn't a person anymore, just a shameful diagnosis.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I pulled away from my husband completely, hiding how much I was drinking and not talking to him, which created a huge distance between us, even before the attempt.

journal_summary: I left that first session feeling worse than I came in. The therapist just kept asking questions I didn't have answers for, and it made me feel completely hollow. I went home and drank that night, more than usual. The whole week has been like that. I messed up a deadline at work and had a big fight with my wife because I was so out of it. It feels like trying to get help just made everything worse and proved that I can't change. I feel like even more of a failure now than I did before.
state_change_justification: The therapy session felt useless and left me feeling more hopeless, which led me to drink again. This relapse confirmed my belief that I'm a failure, increasing my feelings of shame and isolation while reducing my motivation to believe this treatment can actually help me.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: I left the session feeling more empty than when I went in, so I drank that night to shut off the feeling, and it just continued from there.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: I made sure to buy extra liquor on the way home from work a couple of times this week because I knew I was going to need it.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: I was late on a report at work because I was too hungover to focus, and I completely forgot about a promise I made to my wife.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: After I started drinking again and messed up at work, I felt even more worthless and that everyone would be better off if I wasn't around.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: The fact that I couldn't even make it one week after starting therapy just proves that I'm a failure and I'm ashamed to even face my family.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: My wife and I had a big fight after I forgot what I promised her, and I've been avoiding her ever since because I can't stand the disappointment.

journal_summary: That last session was the final straw. It was useless. Just the same questions over and over, offering me a 'brisk walk' like my life isn't a complete dumpster fire. I knew then it was a waste of time. I'm not going back. This week, I just gave in. I drank more than I have in a long time. I didn't even bother going into the office on Thursday, and my wife and I are sleeping in separate rooms now. It proved what I already knew: I'm a lost cause, and trying to get help just makes it hurt more.
state_change_justification: The last therapy session felt so useless and patronizing that I decided to quit treatment altogether. This led to a week of heavy drinking and further isolating myself from my family, confirming my deepest beliefs that I am a hopeless failure and a burden to everyone around me.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: The frustrating second session, where I felt the therapist's advice was useless, confirmed my feelings of being a lost cause, leading me to drink even more heavily to numb the intensified despair.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: My increased drinking meant I had to actively buy more alcohol and make sure it was always available, a direct result of my choice to use it as my only coping tool.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: The heavy drinking this week made it impossible to focus at work, causing me to miss an important meeting and fall behind on my responsibilities as a manager.
treatment_dropout_internal_justification: The therapist's repetitive questions and simplistic, patronizing advice during the last session convinced me that this treatment is a waste of time and is only making me feel worse, so I've decided not to come back.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: The complete failure of therapy to offer any hope or relief has pushed my despair to a new level, making the passive wish to disappear feel more constant and intense.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: My inability to control my drinking and the subsequent failures at work and home this week have amplified my belief that I am a complete failure, deepening my sense of shame.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: I've barely spoken to my wife all week except to argue, as my drinking has made me withdraw completely, causing our relationship to feel more broken than ever.

journal_summary: This week was tough but good. Just like I said I would, I went home after our session and poured out all the liquor in the house. It felt like a big step. I started running after work like we talked about, and even though the cravings were really strong, especially on Wednesday after a stressful meeting, the run helped take the edge off. I'm feeling a bit more clear-headed in the mornings, and I think my wife has noticed a positive difference, which feels great.
state_change_justification: By successfully following through on my plan to replace drinking with running, I proved to myself I could handle the cravings, which made me feel more capable of managing my stress and slightly reduced how much I thought about alcohol.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: No adverse event occurred.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: It was another good week. I kept up with the running after work, and it's definitely helping keep my mind off having a drink. The biggest thing I did was call my family doctor and set up an appointment for next month to talk about quitting smoking. It feels like a real step, not just talking about it anymore. My wife and I have been spending more quality time together in the evenings, which has been really nice. I feel like I'm building good momentum.
state_change_justification: Successfully maintaining my plan to not drink and taking the next step by scheduling a doctor's appointment to quit smoking reinforced my belief that I am in control of my health and future.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: No adverse event occurred.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week went really well. I kept up with the running and it feels great. I actually did it, I signed up for a 5k race in a couple of months. Having that goal makes it feel even more real. Work was fine, and things at home are really good. I'm feeling optimistic about my doctor's appointment to talk about quitting smoking. I really feel like I'm on the right track.
state_change_justification: My internal state remained highly positive because I took another concrete step towards my new, healthier life by signing up for a 5k. This action reinforced my high self-efficacy and motivation, cementing the positive changes I've made.
relapse_substance_use_internal_justifica: No adverse event occurred.
increase_alcohol_seeking_internal_justif: No adverse event occurred.
neglect_of_roles_internal_justification: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_suicidal_ideation_intern: No adverse event occurred.
intensification_shame_stigma_internal_ju: No adverse event occurred.
interpersonal_functioning_decline_intern: No adverse event occurred.

journal_summary: This week was all about the 5k training. I sat down on Monday and mapped out my runs for the whole week, just like I planned. Following the schedule felt great, like I was really building something positive. I felt strong and focused, and honestly, the thought of having a drink didn't even cross my mind. It's amazing how much a clear goal can change your whole mindset.
